author: Hybrid Theory

text: 1:39 to 1:51 is probably my favorite part of the soundtrack. It has that creepy element to it that always show me a picture of snow flying through the air on top of a tall, lonely mountain with skies lit by the sunset in the background. In the distance, I imagine a deserted monastery that has found new purpose in becoming a battlefield. Winds gusting, ear piercing shots ringing through the cold mountain air, and soldiers for the enemy yelling. That is what I see when I hear this song.

author: ragingripto1

text: @Ocliot That's a form of throat singing.  The most commonly known type being Tuvan throat singing, it's a technique where the voice bounces overtones in thr throat and mouth to get a high pitch whistle like sound that can be moved up and down the major pentatonic scale depending on the shape of the mouth.  The "yaaaayeeyaa"" sound is another technique where different folds in the voice box are used in conjuction with normal vocal chords to produce what is known as undertones. THE MORE YOU KNOW.
